revised_title: George White Pickering: A Life in Science and Medicine
tldr: This biographical memoir recounts the life of George White Pickering, a prominent figure in science and medicine. Born in Whalton, Northumberland, Pickering showed an early interest in science and attended the Royal Grammar School in Newcastle. He later attended Dulwich College and then Cambridge University, where he excelled in science and received a scholarship to Pembroke College. After completing his medical studies at St. Thomas' Hospital, Pickering worked at University College Hospital under the leadership of Sir Thomas Lewis, conducting research on blood flow regulation, high blood pressure, and the role of the kidneys. Throughout his life, Pickering remained dedicated to scientific inquiry and education.
